meanings.definition: The action or process of settling among and establishing control over the indigenous people of an area.
meanings.sent1: The colonisation of the new land by the settlers changed the lives of the native people.
meanings.sent2: The history books often talk about the colonisation of different regions by explorers.
meanings.sent3: The colonisation of the remote island led to some interesting cultural exchanges.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for colonisation of ideas in the classroom made her a favorite teacher among students.
meanings.sent5: The colonisation of the garden by the squirrels made it a lively place to observe nature.

meanings.definition: The act of sending settlers to a new country or region to establish control over it.
meanings.sent1: The colonisation of the uncharted territory was a risky but exciting endeavor.
meanings.sent2: Many countries have a history of colonisation in different parts of the world.
meanings.sent3: The colonisation of the moon in science fiction stories always leads to unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her determination in colonisation of new markets for the company brought great success.
meanings.sent5: The colonisation of the barren land turned it into a thriving community over time.
